channel.title: Discoveries of an Adventure-R
channel.description: Recent content on Discoveries of an Adventure-R

item.title: First article and Entry for r/dataisbeautiful DataViz
item.description: As first article on this R and dataviz dedicated blog, I present to you my entry for the DataViz battle of January 2018. This month and the data source is a .htm webpage containing several algae growthrates according to light and temperature conditions. For this project I used : 1. R for * Data importatation * Data wrangling and cleaning * Final analysis Tableau Public Data exploration Detailed data dashboard So let’s start with R !

item.title: How I built this blog
item.description: nerjfnerifnerio htmltools::HTML("{{< <!--more--> >}}") {{}} Material Used : https://tclavelle.github.io/blog/blogdown_github/ https://bookdown.org/yihui/blogdown/github-pages.html https://talesofr.wordpress.com/2017/08/18/starting-a-rmarkdown-blog-with-bookdown-hugo-github/ https://yihui.name/en/2017/08/hugo-post-summary/#fnref:I-broke-the-4th How to create 2 repo username/source username/username.github.io clone repo on computer and remove readme files start new R project project option -> website, select source as base directory load necessary libraries # Load blogdown package and install Hugo library(blogdown) install_hugo() choose a theme set “source” as working directory create site # Create new site in our recently cloned blogdown repository new_site(theme = "kakawait/hugo-tranquilpeak-theme", format = 'toml') add folowing lines in config.
